ActionScript
bonus bids:

colors cleared
percent complete
pts
PLAY AGAIN
skip tutorial

The goal is to cover the whole board with the same color. Starting in the top-left corner field, you do this by clicking the paint buckets below the board. The captured fields will change to the selected color and the captured area will increase if adjacent fields match that color.
For example: Click the red paint bucket.

See how the three red fields are connected? That means they’re now captured. Continue choosing colors until you’ve run out of time, or you've run out of your 25 allowed captures (clicks). You must choose wisely, but also quickly!
Next: Click the green paint bucket to capture those three green fields that are connected to the already captured ones.
Next: Click the purple paint bucket.
Next: Click the orange paint bucket.
Finally: Click the blue paint bucket and you'll fill the board!
Congratulations - you’ve finished the tutorial! Think you’re ready for Color Capture?
How Bids Are Won
Percent Complete - The primary goal of Color Capture is to capture as much of the board as you can by turning it all the same color. The more fields you capture, the more bids you earn.
Colors Cleared - You’ll be awarded an additional five bids for each color you wipe off the board.

Time Remaining - If you capture the entire board, you’ll be awarded a bonus bid for every ten seconds left on the timer. Example: 17 seconds remaining earns one bonus bid, 22 seconds earns two bonus bids, etc.
How Points Are Won
Percent Complete - The primary goal of Color Capture is to capture as much of the board as you can by turning it all the same color. The more fields you capture, the more points you earn.
Colors Cleared - You’ll be awarded an additional fifty points for each color you wipe off the board.

Time Remaining - If you capture the entire board, you’ll be awarded the number of seconds remaining on the timer as many times as you have steps remaining. Example: 17 seconds remaining earns 17 points if you used up all 25 steps, but 34 points if you only needed 24 steps to clear the board, and 51 points for 23 steps, etc.
